string_data:
ID: Daily-Mail_2024-03-14_Just-Stop-Oils
Source: Daily-Mail
Title: Just Stop Oil's pink-haired 'poster girl' Phoebe Plummer is arrested while delivering a letter to Emily Thornberry's house days after she was detained over plot to target MPs' homes
Content: #DS #PH #CS Just Stop Oil 's poster girl was arrested after delivering a letter to Emily Thornberry's house (Alt: The image shows two people on the front steps of a brick townhouse with a white-painted facade and blue door numbered 12. One person wears an orange/rust colored long dress or skirt with a dark top, while the other wears all black with a patterned cardigan. There are potted plants on the steps and a black iron railing. Text overlay reads ) #CE
New footage shows Just Stop Oil's pink-haired poster girl being arrested after delivering a letter to Emily Thornberry's house.Phoebe Plummer, 22, is a prolific protester who has been arrested for a string of disturbances. In March, she was detained on suspicion of conspiracy to burgle and of sending a malicious communication after the Mail exposed an alleged plot to target MPs.The privately-educated activist has now been arrested for breaching her bail conditions, with footage showing her walking up to MP Emily Thornberry's door. The video posted on social media shows Plummer posting the letter with a friend. It then cuts to show several police officers asking if she has ID.An officer then returns, and said: 'We've just spoken to our inspector... you will be under arrest for breaching police bail conditions.' He then asks if she was aware of the bail conditions not to attend a MP's home address. #DE
#PH #CS Phoebe Plummer, 22, is a prolific protester who has been arrested for a string of disturbances (Alt: The image shows several young people on a residential street with Victorian-style buildings. A person with pink hair wearing black clothing is speaking, with subtitled text reading ) #CE
#MS Speaking to the camera, she then said: 'So apparently this is the world we live in now. Getting arrested, literally for just posting a letter through to somebody's house...somebody's front door. That's so far from a crime, isn't it?' #ME #NS To which the police officer replied: 'You've got these bail conditions for a reason, haven't you.' #NE #MS She responded: 'To prevent that. This is what it was trying to prevent. Just delivering a letter.' #ME #DS The video cuts to footage of a police van arriving, and Plummer climbs in before turning and waving, saying: 'See you guys later!' and laughs. #DE Pink-haired Plummer grew up in privilege, raised in a £4million family home near the King's Road in Chelsea and privately educated at £45,000-a year St Mary's School in Ascot, Berkshire, then £34,000-a-year Mander Portman Woodward College in Kensington, west London.
#DS #PH #CS The video posted on social media shows Plummer posting the letter with a friend. It then cuts to show several police officers asking if she has ID. Pictured climbing into a police van (Alt: The image shows a person with pink hair wearing a black top and orange pants climbing into the back of a white police van. The van's rear doors are open, revealing a metal cage-like interior. A police officer's hand holding what appears to be paperwork is visible on the right side of the frame.) #CE #DE
